storyInfo: Feist helps a factory optimize their production lines, but he never foresaw the possibility that 'optimization' was not always inspirational.

attributes.content: Granny? Didn't you say you'd be back late tonight?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Oh, come on now, don't give me the silent treatment. I feel like I've done something wrong here.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Oh, it's you, Stan.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: S-Sorry, I, err, wasn't trying to scare you or anything...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: It's fine, it's fine. Lighten up.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Say, isn't this the first time you've dropped over to mine?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Have a sit and I'll whip you up a snack. You're fine with tangerine fizzy drinks, yeah? Help yourself. As for that snack...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I've brought something.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Nice. Let's see... Fried fin and potato pie? Bit more of a meal than a snack, no?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: ...I made it myself.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Suppose I'll have a try, then.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Get me a can as well while you're at it!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: No, not over there, under the kitchen cupboard where we put the brooms!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: *glug* *glug*... Man, that taste...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Me Da said he'd rather chew on his welding rod than eat my cooking.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: The flavor is a tad bit... intense.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Help me out here, Feist. Don't doom the boys at the factory to eat this day after day.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: As you know, I ain't got any talents other than learning how to weld from me Da. I was just waiting to be let into his team. He's discussed it all with the factory director already.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Wait, don't tell me...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Last month, they went on an 'optimization' spree at the assembly line all for the sake of 'improving our manufacturing efficiency', so me Da got 'optimized' to the cafeteria—
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: No way!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Now, I'm slated to join his team there, but even after half a month's worth of practice at home, I can't even get the simplest thing done in the kitchen, let alone cook anything edible.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Me Da's about to retire, Feist, and I'd rather not get kicked out of the cafeteria then fired from the factory the moment he's gone.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: That optimization plan was my idea...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It was?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Nah, I don't blame you. When you were little, you were already talking about how you wanted to get the whole factory modernized. You managed to put your money where your mouth is, unlike me...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Anyhow, since you were the one who came up with it, d'you think you could change it back? Put me Da back on the assembly line?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I'm not sure the director would be too happy to do it... but we'd better go see him, just in case.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Worst comes to worst, I could ask around and see if any other lines need a welder.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I-If you could?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Just leave it to me.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: So, what'd the director say, Feist?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: You don't look too good. Don't tell me—No, don't tell me the director... Was he... mad?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Nah. You should've seen that why-should-I give-a-damn-about-anyone-else look on his face... I almost couldn't help but stuff your fried fin down his gob.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: He insists there's no going back. As for the assembly line, he says he sent your dad to the cafeteria because there were no vacancies at the factory in the first place.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Damn. Me Da's been all over Highbury the last few days, says a real big manufacturer went bankrupt recently. Not even the lads with experience can find work. A wet-behind-the-ears guy like me... No factory's going to want me.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: You could try something outside a factory. Maybe try your hand at business? Start a small grocery, something like that?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Or maybe the railway? I'm not too familiar with them, not sure if they're recruiting.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Or, err, even dormitory cleaner's not a bad job. It's hard work, but at least you'll be paid...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I'm the one who got you into this mess, so it's my responsibility to get you out. Come on, let's head home and change into something nicer. We'll set out and look for work in the afternoon.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: ...Not a single bite.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'll jot down the places we hit up today. We can try our luck in some other borough tomorrow.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Damn bloody pen's dried up... Dammit!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: How about we just call it here, Feist.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Like I said, I can't blame you for this. Technology marches on, and even if you weren't around, the director would've 'optimized' some people out eventually.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Talented guys like you can find their place no matter how tech develops, but people like me... We're not the same.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I don't have any work experience or book smarts, my family's got no money, and I'm not a people person like you, able to get along with everyone...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Don't be so hard on yourself, Stan. We were just unlucky today.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: But we've already scoured all of Highbury, and Auchterigg too—
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Why so glum, chaps? Worried about how to pay your bills? Not happy with your work? Or maybe you got let off by one of the Highbury factories?
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: And who might you be, Mister...?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'm a recruiter. Interested?
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: That's great! Recruiting for what?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Well, what line of work are you two in?
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: Welding.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Welders are just what we need. C'mon, I'll show you our factory.
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: Where is it? We've spent the whole day checking every single one in Highbury and none of them needed welders. Is it just opened?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Err, yeah.
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: In Magna Borough maybe? We were going to try our luck there tomorrow.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Sure enough, that's the place—
attributes.name: Questionable Man

attributes.content: Opening a factory in a posh borough like that? You tell a good joke, mister. Let's go, Stan.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: A damp, warm night breeze blows through Highbury from a corner beyond the streetlamp's reach, causing them to shiver.
I'll be heading home, I guess.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: And then?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I dunno. Me Da's pension isn't enough to keep himself fed. I know he wants to take care of me, but we'll both starve if he does...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Sorry Feist, you don't need to listen to my bellyaching. You've done enough.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I'm just going to go back to the factory and join the cafeteria. I should be able to muddle my way through.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Back to the factory... Join the cafeteria...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: That might just work out.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Glad you agree—
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: No, Stan. I'm not letting you give up here. Like I said, this is my responsibility.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: If you can't cook, then I'll take your place.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: What about your work?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: You can handle it, optimizing lines and suchlike.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Are you serious?!
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Better than slaving away in a kitchen, am I right?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I-I dunno, I really don't have any talent like you do...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: If you don't give it a try, how do you know you're not talented at it?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'll talk things over with Granny and the director. Give it a shot, won't you?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Swap positions? I don't know what's gotten into your heads. What does your grandmother think, Feist? Is she really alright with this lunacy?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: If she wasn't, I wouldn't be here talking with you.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Heaven knows why you're being so stubborn about this... Forget it.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Very well then, swap positions. But mark my words, there can be no disruptions to either the assembly line or the cafeteria. If there's any trouble, it'll be you two bearing the consequences.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: W-Will we be fired?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: A firing would be the least of your troubles. If anything happens, you'll be compensating for our losses in full!
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Feist? Is that really you?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: 'Tis.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The director told me all about it yesterday. I thought it was just you youngsters up to some nonsense.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Since you two are serious, I won't coddle you. Do what needs to be done, and don't make a mess of things. Got that?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Good. Now get those baskets of potatoes peeled.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: You're quite the neat peeler—Wait, how come so many of these little potatoes only have a single cut? Been testing one of your 'inventions' again?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Ahaha...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I don't care how you get them peeled, but you need to clean up your own mess.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Will do. No need to worry, sir.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Seems like I need to do some more troubleshooting—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I-I've got a bit of a situation on my hands here, Feist, and I really dunno how to fix it. I've got to ask you something.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: No problem, ask away.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It's about belt B7... Seems like it's running slower than the belts further down the line...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Slower? Might be something jamming it. Did you go through the entire pre-startup inspection?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I-I did it all like the manual said...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: How about the drive motors?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'll have a look—Oh, there really was...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: As long as you managed to find the issue. If there's anything else, just call.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Idle hands, Feist! I could hear you chattering away on the walkie-talkie!
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: I-I'll be done real quick!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Let's try turning the angle of the blade a bit...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: All peeled! Passing them over now, sir—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Hold on a second, let me take a look...
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: You sure are something, Feist. Standardizing the size of the potatoes? Is this how you cook at home?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Well, at home it's just me and Granny, but here in the cafeteria we're feeding an entire factory. I thought it'd be more efficient this way.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: And if you look here, I was tinkering with this potato-cutting machine last night. As long as the potatoes are all the same size—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Alright, I heard enough! So what about the bits of the potato the machine lopped off? Just going to throw them away?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Since it's still your first day, peel a few more potatoes to make up for the extra waste. And make sure you use a normal knife this time!
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Hmm, these one's aren't half-bad.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Once I teach you how to fry the fins, I'll be making the potato pies, so chop chop—Another one of your infernal contraptions? Going to use it to debone the fins?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Well, more than just debone—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Don't bother, we use frozen fillets here. It's not as tricky as you think.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Here's how you batter them. I'll only show you once, so remember it well.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Feist—
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Put that communicator down. If you keep dawdling, the entire factory'll starve.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Yes, sir...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Remember what I said about the flour blend? Half all-purpose, half self-rising... Right, just like that.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Wait! Don't beat those yolks into the batter! How are you going to get your foam afterwards?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: ...Forget it, just mix it all together and get those fillets covered. Surely you know how to fry it—Don't just put something wet into a deep-fryer! The hell do you cook at home?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Stewed veggies and the like.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: *sigh* Never mind. Not like I've got enough oil in my own home to deep-fry things myself.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Finally, it's done. Let me have a taste—
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Eurgh! How did you manage to make them taste so raw?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: What's the time right now—Oh, bollocks.
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: I don't have the time to walk you through everything again, so I'll write the instructions down. Please follow them step by step, alright?
attributes.name: Cafeteria Manager

attributes.content: Sorry...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: How's things on your end, Stan? What did you call me for earlier?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The production line's sorta... stopped...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Stopped?!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Wait right there, I'm coming over!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: One volunteer in the cafeteria, and of the fried fins he prepared for the factory men, a quarter was burnt, a quarter was raw, and the last half was left forgotten to stink up the kitchen.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: As for our other volunteer, he might have an even more impressive record: Insufficient pre-startup inspections and an inability to resolve issues when they came up, giving our workers half a day off thanks to the paralyzed lines.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Remember how I told you boys you would be bearing the consequences?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: No need to come in tomorrow, Stan. You'll need the time to sort your life out.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Director, this was all my idea—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Don't think you're off the hook. It was his mess, but you're responsible. You get back to optimizing the lines. Today's losses are coming out of your wages, mind.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: You can forget seeing another penny from me for the rest of the year.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: How could you even think of something like that?!
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Oho, still have some vim and vigor in you?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: The line stoppage was my fault, so I'll pay the cost! Wouldn't Feist paying for the fins be enough?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Pay? With what money? Your father's pension?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Director.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Ah, Catherine, you're here. Take your grandson home already so you can teach him not to cause so much trouble.
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Don't worry, Feist is a clever kid. He doesn't need reminding when he needs to learn something. I'm here to talk about other business.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Hmph. These two have caused quite the ruckus in this factory. What more is there to talk about?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: I don't remember you looking like this when I came to chat with you a while ago.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Granny?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: *cough*!
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Take Stan back to ours, Feist. I've got quite a few things to discuss with the director here.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Granny—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The director gave in. Feist, you can go back to the line, and Stan can go back to the cafeteria. The two of you will be docked a month's wages.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I managed to put a good word in with him earlier, but I suppose he's still rather pissed off at the two of you.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Since he's being like that, I had no choice but to mention a few sketchy things we noticed that the public didn't.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Sorry, Granny...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Don't apologize to me, apologize to the boys in the factory tomorrow.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: And here, your fried fins. The cafeteria packed them up for you.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You fried them, you eat them. I don't care what state they were in, they weren't off when you dipped them in the fryer.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I'll be off now. You two, think long and hard about what you'll be doing next.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: *sigh*
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Feeling peckish, Stan?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: ...A tad.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Man, it still stinks even after it cooled down... We should find somewhere else to talk—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Let's head to the lift platform. We can find somewhere high up and stargaze a bit.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Hff—haaaah... Been a while since I climbed so high.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Yeah, it's a lot comfier here than in the workshop.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I've never really thought so.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Figured you'd say that.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Say what?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: When I was inspecting everything this morning, I saw all the little notes you left behind.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Things like 'Two loops here, no more' or 'To Sam: don't forget the corners and gaps when cleaning'. The handwriting's a bit carefree, and some of them even have a little smiley face at the end.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Even if I knew the entire line in and out, I wouldn't be able to bring myself to draw one of those. I just can't smile down there.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I wasn't smiling much in the cafeteria either.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Suppose I better start getting these fried fins down.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: They rotten?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: No, but they stink to high heaven.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I'll have a bite, then.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The two of them each nibble on a piece of fried fin.

The nauseating scent of burnt batter and raw fin is blown away by the night wind, and to the two young men who had not eaten all afternoon out of nervousness, even cold fin fillets carried a hint of appetizing aroma.
Not sure if you still remember, but there was one time you lead us younger kids up here, and we spent the entire night playing together. The next day, everyone got a right trashing when we went home.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Of course I remember. Granny was furious, since I was the leader and all.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We talked about what we wanted to do when we grew up. You were the first one to speak up. You said the factories were driving Londinium into the future, and you wanted to be the guy driving the factories.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: You said there'd be a day when machines would do all the work for us. We'd just need to pop into the office, press a few buttons, then call it a day—
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Er, did I say something wrong?
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: No, it's just that even after all the effort I put in, we're actually further away from that dream than before.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Granny was right. I'm too immature. All I could think about was how to make things more efficient, and along the way, I forgot what kind of place a factory actually is.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: If there really does come a day we could just push a few buttons, why would a factory need to hire so many people?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: *sigh* If I wasn't so optimization-obsessed, you'd be a fine welder right now.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Maybe not. Truth be told, I don't really want to be a welder.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Y-You don't?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We grew up in the factories, so we all know what a factory man's life is like.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: You either stand at the line the entire day, or you're clambering up and down the machines to service them. People think you make parts, or weld pipes, but you actually never get to see your own result.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: The only time I really wanted to be a factory man was the time a lady manning the lathe gave me a perfectly round ball she made out of some scrap metal.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: But most of the time, her works just went right down the belt before I could even make out their shape. Just parts of one big process in the end.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: In the distant factory district, the night shift disembarks from the railway carriages, while the day shift trickle out of the countless factories of Highbury after a hard day's work.
The workers seem nothing compared to the giant buildings behind them.
You can see the factory as a whole. You know what everyone's work actually means. That's why I say you've got talent and I don't.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: You know which bit of the finished product you made yourself and what it does, even if the parts have nothing to do with us once they leave the factory...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: But I can't do that. To me, factory work's a job where you never get to see the fruits of your labor. You just make the same thing day after day for some cash.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: The factory won't let go of you, but me? I'm just a welding rod to them. A lousy one, 'just like burnt fins,' according to me Da. They'd throw me away without a second thought.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I know there's nothing wrong with it, really. I'm just not used to factory work.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Back when we were little, I never said what I wanted to be when I grew up, because I didn't know.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I just want to do something that I can see through from start to end... Something I can...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Something I can point at when I'm off the clock and proudly tell people: 'You see this? I did that!' ...Something like that.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: I don't care what it is. A chair, a set of knives, a sick guy who got better under my care, even a burdenbeast raised by myself...
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: But I was born to a factory man, and so I should be a welder. Because that's what me Da is.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: The railcars tug on their whistles as they take the workers clocking out back to their dorms, like the whinnies of a burdenbeast.
He'll be back home soon. We should go.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: Wait, Stan. There's... There's some things I still don't get.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Afraid there's no time for that.
attributes.name: Stan

attributes.content: After heading down the platform, Feist returns home, looking over the blueprints he was so proud of once more.
He had always thought of the factory as a whole. It's how his granny does it, so he thought that's how others would too.
But as it turns out, not so.
He thinks of the time he was handling those last few potatoes in the kitchen. He didn't have the least idea what they would become, nor did he really care.
He feels like his impression of the kitchen is more or less the same as Stan's impression of the factory. Maybe even a little better, actually.
At least fried fins and potato pies would make their way back into his belly eventually. But a factory's products? The workers don't have anything to do with them.
Maybe he could drive the factory into the future some day, but what about the workers like Stan, the ones who don't want to do fruitless tasks forever and ever, without knowing anything else?
Workers like Stan who wouldn't even get the chance to work a never-ending job?
Stop the finished parts on the line for a bit? No, if every segment stopped, the total time lost would be unacceptable.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Maybe.. make the line out of transparent materials? Though I'm not sure anywhere even has that technology, let alone the cost...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Or maybe some sort of handover process once the goods are leaving the factory that involves all the workers?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: That damn factory director would have to sign off on it, though. No, it's got to be something to do with the line itself...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: What's wrong with me today? Why can't I think of anything that'll work? There's got to be a way—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Oh, Granny...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Us night shifters just clocked out. Why're you not asleep yet?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Blueprints? You thinking of getting Stan back on the line?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I am.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Do you really know what he wants?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: He wants... to make something he can see the end product of. Something he can point at when he's off the clock and say that it's his work.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: And you're helping him do this?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I'm trying my best.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Good, I'm glad you didn't cause such a ruckus for nothing.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But this isn't something you can do with a few late nights. Stay calm and take it easy. You've got more time left than me to see it through.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Also, I was just talking to Stan's father. Stan's decided to leave Highbury. Leave Londinium, even.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: What's he—
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Apparently, he wants to try his luck in some nearby villages, see if he can raise some burdenbeasts.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Go get some sleep, Feist.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine's tone is firm, and Feist can feel the sleepiness building up behind his brow.
He drags his worn body to his bed and flings himself on it, falling into slumber as the sun rises behind his curtains.

He dreams of Stan mounting a burdenbeast, a treasured companion he raised from a calf. He sits astride the beast's wide back, and with one great leap off the top of the building, he rides off away from the city.
As for Feist himself? He waves farewell, then turns back to Londinium, back into his workshop.
